data.title: An Evening with Cornell West
data.meta_site_name: Speakers Series | An Evening with Cornell West
data.text:
An Evening of Conversation

Friday, January 17, 2020

6:30 p.m.

Smithwick Theatre

Buy TicketS

Please join Dr. Cornel West to discuss democracy, race and justice. The evening will also include a question and answer session with Foothill College students. Proceeds will benefit Foothill College Service Leadership and Equity scholarships.

About Dr. Cornel West

Cornel West is a professor, philosopher, author and activist.

A prominent and provocative democratic intellectual, he is Professor of the Practice of Public Philosophy at Harvard University and holds the title of Professor Emeritus at Princeton University. He has also taught at Union Theological Seminary, Yale, Harvard, and the University of Paris. Cornel West graduated Magna Cum Laude from Harvard in three years and obtained his M.A. and Ph.D. in Philosophy at Princeton.
